comments.content: Don't know it, could be hand-drawn. Some I like as alternatives: [Gelateria HT](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/ht-gelateria), [Cookie](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Cookie), [Satisfy](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/neapolitan/satisfy-pro), [Miss Donna](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scholtz/miss-donna), [Engagement](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Engagement), [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/metroscript), [Old Glory](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/artandsignstudio.com/oldglory.html), [Mervale](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.ffonts.net/MervaleScript-Regular.font), many [Aring Type Måns Grebäck](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.aringtypeface.com/categories/all-fonts) (Brannboll/NY, Impregnable, Intrigue, Amplify, Stainy...)

Hi Ryuk,  
thanks for your suggestions, some good ones in there:)  
what i like about the type in question is it's legibility, it reads so smooth to me.  
cheers!
Glad to help. Totally agree with you. That may be a reason why it could be hand-drawn. It's kind of hard to create a flawless lettering and even with OpenType features and ligatures.

The clarification is helpful. I interpret it as quest for legible, round & loopy.  
You might try Pacifico:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PacificoInUseSM_3830.jpg)
  
 [http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/pacifico](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/pacifico "http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/pacifico")  
Don

Previous thread might have something that interests you:  
"Suggest bold, legible, italic/cursive font?"  
 [http://typophile.com/node/85937](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/typophile.com/node/85937 "http://typophile.com/node/85937")  
Don

Here's another. Japan, traced form an old Dover Book on handwritten type, by Mario Arturo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043im_/http:/typophile.com/files/JapanInUseSM_6449.jpg)
  
 [http://www.dafont.com/japan.font?text=Everflow&psize=l](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307124043/http:/www.dafont.com/japan.font?text=Everflow&psize=l "http://www.dafont.com/japan.font?text=Everflow&psize=l")  
Dob

thanks donshottype!  
that was very helpful.  
have a good one.
